intro: Anthriscus sylvestris subsp. candollei, commonly known as the slender cow parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its foliage is finely divided, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils in partial shade to full sun. This subspecies is often found in woodland edges and moist meadows, where it contributes to biodiversity and supports pollinators.
